intro: Adinandra formosana var. obtusissima, commonly known as the Formosan adinandra, is a rare evergreen shrub native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions with rich, well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
